title: BuckState T-shirt
content:
Hi friends

Somebody can help me id the font used on the t-shirt BuckState...or similars

thanks

Miguel

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [buck.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907044655/http:/typophile.com/files/buck.jpg) | 12.97 KB |

 [‹ Wine Vineyard Font](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907044655/http:/www.typophile.com/node/42919 "Go to previous forum topic") ["Brand New" bitmap font? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907044655/http:/www.typophile.com/node/42971 "Go to next forum topic")
author: hernando

comments.content:
The different ’t’s make me think this is custom lettering.

- Lex

It’s possible it’s custom, it’s also possible it’s a script with alternatives.

I think it’s also possible it’s a few fonts and some modifications thrown together.

“Buck” and “tate” look very similar to [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/itfmecanorma/script-bold/](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907044655/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/itfmecanorma/script-bold/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/itfmecanorma/script-bold/") Script Bold. The S might be free hand, or another brush or marker script all together (it does look familiar).

then if you look at dafont, there’s Marcelle which could have been the inspiration (it’s clearly a modified Script Bold.) [http://www.dafont.com/marcelle.font?nb\_ppp=50&psize=l&text=Buck+State](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907044655/http:/www.dafont.com/marcelle.font?nb_ppp=50&psize=l&text=Buck+State "http://www.dafont.com/marcelle.font?nb\_ppp=50&psize=l&text=Buck+State")

If you want to find some similar type fonts, try [www.letterheadfonts.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907044655/http:/www.letterheadfonts.com/ "www.letterheadfonts.com"). They have some great script type fonts, ideal for these types of logos.

JH
